name: Nordisk Jægersamvirke
memberOrga: Danmarks Jægerforbund (Danish Hunters' Association - www.jaegerforbundet.dk ) - Finlands Jägareförbund - Suomen Metsästäjäliitto (Finnish Hunters' Association - www.metsastajaliitto.fi ) - Norges Jeger- og Fiskerforbund (Norwegian Association of Hunters and Anglers - www.njff.no ) - Skotveiðifélag Íslands (Icelandic Hunters’ Association - www.skotvis.is ) - Svenska Jägareförbundet (Swedish Association for Hunting and Wildlife Management - www.jagareforbundet.se ) - Jägarnas Riksförbund (Swedish National Association of Huntsmen - www.jagarnasriksforbund.se ) - Ålandsøernes jagtvårdsföreninger (Aaland Islands' Hunting Associations)
goal: Nordisk Jægersamvirke / Nordic Hunters’ Alliance (NJS) is a non-profit organisation representing approximately 600,000 hunters and shooters in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark and Iceland. NJA promotes the Nordic hunting tradition and ethics as a sustainable model in European hunting and wildlife management.
interests: Agriculture, Culture, Environment, Food Safety, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Trade
euInitiatives: EU and international policy and legislative files concerning hunting and wildlife management, such as the EU nature directives, rules on firearms and ammunition, animal welfare and health, CAP, invasive alien species, trapping, and wildlife trade.
